newsitem.title: UK: B.A.T reorganises cigar industry business.
newsitem.headline: B.A.T reorganises cigar industry business.

text.p: British American Tobacco (Holdings) Ltd, a unit of B.A.T Industries, said on Thursday it sold its Henri Wintermans Cigar Group to Skandinavisk Tobakskompagni A/S of Denmark for 55 million stg cash.
British American Tobacco said the sale would result in a small pre-tax profit.
BAT holds a 32.15 percent share in Skandinavisk Tobakskompagni. The existing sales and distribution relationships would be maintained, the company said.
BAT said the amalgamation of Henri Wintermans with Skandinavisk Tobakskompagni's Nobel Cigars unit would create one of Europe's largest cigar groups.
It said the combined group would have greater growth potential. It would be based at Henri Wintermans Sigarenfabrieken B.V. in Eersel, the Netherlands.
